Application.description:
Defines a complete QType application specification.

An Application is the top-level container of the entire
program in a QType YAML file. It serves as the blueprint for your
AI-powered application, containing all the models, flows, tools, data sources,
and configuration needed to run your program. Think of it as the main entry
point that ties together all components into a cohesive,
executable system.

memories.description: List of memory definitions used in this application.
memories.title: Memories

models.description: List of models used in this application.
models.title: Models

types.description: List of custom types defined in this application.
types.title: Types

variables.description: List of variables available at the application scope.
variables.title: Variables

flows.description: List of flows defined in this application.
flows.title: Flows

auths.description: List of authorization providers used for API access.
auths.title: Auths

tools.description: List of tools available in this application.
tools.title: Tools

indexes.description: List of indexes available for search operations.
indexes.title: Indexes

references.description: List of other q-type documents you may use. This allows modular composition and reuse of components across applications.
references.title: References

Application.title: Application

Decoder.description:
Defines a step that decodes string data into structured outputs.

If parsing fails, the step will raise an error and halt execution.
Use conditional logic in your flow to handle potential parsing errors.

cardinality.description: Does this step emit 1 (one) or 0...N (many) instances of the outputs?

inputs.description: References to the variables required by this step.
inputs.title: Inputs

outputs.description: References to the variables where output is stored.
outputs.title: Outputs

format.description: Format in which the decoder processes data. Defaults to JSON.

Decoder.title: Decoder

DecoderFormat.description: Defines the format in which the decoder step processes data.
DecoderFormat.title: DecoderFormat

DocToTextConverter.description:
Defines a step to convert raw documents (e.g., PDF, DOCX) loaded by a DocumentSource into plain text
using an external tool like Docling or LlamaParse for pre-processing before chunking.
The input and output are both RAGDocument, but the output after processing with have content of type markdown.

cardinality.description: Does this step emit 1 (one) or 0...N (many) instances of the outputs?

inputs.description: References to the variables required by this step.
inputs.title: Inputs

outputs.description: References to the variables where output is stored.
outputs.title: Outputs

DocToTextConverter.title: DocToTextConverter

Document.description:
Schema for any valid QType document structure.

This allows validation of standalone lists of components, individual components,
or full QType application specs. Supports modular composition and reuse.

DocumentSource.description:
A source of documents that will be used in retrieval augmented generation.
It uses LlamaIndex readers to load one or more raw Documents
from a specified path or system (e.g., Google Drive, web page).
See https://github.com/run-llama/llama_index/tree/main/llama-index-integrations/readers

id.description: Unique ID of the data source.
id.title: Id

cardinality.description: A DocumentSource always emits 0...N instances of documents.
cardinality.title: Cardinality

inputs.description: References to the variables required by this step.
inputs.title: Inputs

outputs.description: References to the variables where output is stored.
outputs.title: Outputs

reader_module.description: Module path of the LlamaIndex Reader without 'llama_index.readers' (e.g., 'google.GoogleDriveReader', 'file.IPYNBReader').
reader_module.title: Reader Module

args.description: Reader-specific arguments to pass to the LlamaIndex constructor.
args.title: Args

Flow.description:
Defines a flow of steps that can be executed in sequence or parallel.
If input or output variables are not specified, they are inferred from
the first and last step, respectively.
